author: Greg
title: Prepaid Debit Card
description: We can use QR codes to send ADA to each other, but can we buy a cup of coffee with ADA?

assessments.note: I give an impact score of 1 for several reasons. The challenge is to bring value to users in 2021 but it does not seem feasible for this card to launch in 2021, as the proposer states - it is no easy task to become a card issuer. It also isn't clear why Cardano funded prepaid debit cards are important. Almost no metrics or scaling addressed in the proposal.

I really did not see much advantage to have this kind of product. It's just another method to do one thing that can already be done without taxes, depending on your money exchange. 
If you had a card which gives cashback in ADA would be more interesting.

I see this idea as feasible and aligned with the Challenge's goals. Although, I don't see any great advantage of such a system. Since the ADA would be converted into FIAT to pop-up the debit card, the only difference between doing this via this Dapp and using an usual debit card is that it would be done in a single step. I believe it should be considered some way to keep the balance in ADA in the wallet, and also to find aspects to differentiate from other cards, for e.g. cashback. It would be good to check what other solutions already exist. The non-custodial aspect of this current solution already is a good differential.

Challenge is "What applications will provide the most value for end users in 2021?". By the proposers own admission this project is a long goal. Thus it does not meet the challenge (even though it would be great to pull off).

This proposal would have a great impact on giving the ability to spend ADA funds through fiat means and gives ADA greater utility.  It would impact all ADA holders.  This proposal is more on the MVP side to help prove the concept is possible, this impact won't affect the greater community at the conclusion, but it will drive further development steps to bring fiat-based card spending that is funded by ADA.  Explaining the impact of the MVP will help make the stronger case for spending on this proposal and subsequent future development that would be required.
What might be improved on this system is that my ADA will be sold directly against fiat, but only when I need it for actual payment for a purchage. Then then it is staked or lend (for interest)

I give a 1 for feasibility because the proposer describes that it is very difficult to become a card issuer but provides no evidence that they will be able to accomplish the task. There is no marketing plan for how to get people to use this over the already existing prepaid debit cards.

Looking into the proposer CV, it seems that he can create this product.
I am wondering how much would cost to create the plastic card and the logistics and if you have thought in all logistic nuances – in which country to starts, how the card would be distributed, how many people you need to expand, etc.

The proposer has very relevant experience to achieve the proposal's goal. The fact that is it seems that a single person would be responsible for all the development is a down side, but it's acceptable. The proposal mentions that multiple funds would be needed for the full development, but it is not clear what the other further developments are planned. Also, there is a risk of not getting extra fund, and this scenario should be assessed.

Proposer has not covered any of the regulatory hurdles that may be involved in setting this up. Are there money laundering of KYC issues that would need to be covered before VISA would allow this? These are probably much bigger than the technical issues and should be addressed.

This proposal is designed off a previous successful project on another blockchain which is promising that the same concept can be applied to Cardano.  The working team consists of the proposer who has experience in this area.  The proposer should describe if this will be a sole-developer project or it will require additional help to complete the MVP.  It appears that a userbase for the desire of the project and potentially to test would need to be flushed out.  The value of the proposal request appears reasonable, but maybe an additional layer of breakdown would make it more transparent.
As already described, issuing a Debit card is hard to do. It requires a company with large funds and marketing skills to spread it over the world
I give a 1 for auditability because the metrics identified are vague. The proposer does not indicate what values for each metric would indicate success. Time horizon uses general milestones.
I wish you had a more detailed roadmap which would explain or give milestones in which we could verify the dev of working.

Metrics and KPIs are stated, some number would improve even more this information. The roadmap is simple, but clear and effective. The risk of not being funded again, if the first fund is received, was not assessed to inform what would be the plan if such a thing happens.
More detail needs to be supplied on any regulatory hurdles and how they will be addressed. What country is the proposer intending on doing the MVP in? Is it the UK?

Additional details would be nice, in addition to a roadmap to have an idea of what the deliverables and timeline would be with more details.  The basic timeline provided but not sure if any buffer is considered since it appears to be developed by a sole user.
In my opinion it required a ot of time and funds to realize this project and carries a lot of uncertainties for success and even then it might fail because of the absence of marketing skills

solution: Prepaid card could be a link between today's analog world and digital payment future that we all strive for.
